intro: Neolemonniera ogouensis, commonly known as the African yellowwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish-white fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Neolemonniera ogouensis is valued for its hard, durable wood and is also used in traditional medicine.
